title: How to Get Started on Virtual Villagers 3

steps.headline: Drag a random villager (not the woman with the baby!)
steps.description: to the little piece of fruit behind the broken machine and under the tree. If you can't find it, go to the map and click somewhere in the top right corner. The villager will pick up the fruit and plant it. You will either have bananas, coconuts, or mangoes, depending on the fruit you start out with. When your tree is finished growing, a farmer can harvest fruit from it.

steps.headline: Drag a villager, preferably with building experience (he or she should have Skill: Trainee Builder) to the firewood pile near the beehive.
Drag another preferably-a-builder villager to the pile of dry grass by the waterfall and above the research building.
When the villagers in Steps 2 and 3 have put their items in the fire pit (in the very middle of the map) drag one of them to the pit again.
Drag a villager that you want to become the farmer to the beehive.
steps.description: They will probably run away. So, drag them to the blackened sticks (torches) next to the beehive. They will start Trying an idea! They will light the torches and hold them in front of the beehive. The bees will fly away and your farmer can start harvesting honey.

steps.headline: Drag all the villagers (except the woman with the baby) to the pedestal by the amphitheater.
steps.description: They will try on the cloak. The cloak will fit a villager and the villager will become the Tribal Chief! They help, but they don't work.

steps.headline: Drag one builder to the broken hut, close to the fire pit.
steps.description: He or she will start to repair it.

steps.headline: Drag your other builder to the big rock covered with leaves in the graveyard, close to the Black Orchid.
steps.description: The builder will start removing the leaves.

steps.headline: Drag your Chief to the Granary, the little hut where the food is stored.
steps.description: He will begin Making magical food!

steps.headline: Drag any remaining people to the research table in the researching circle.
steps.description: Make sure they research! If you don't have anybody left to research... wait until the food supply (on the side of the screen) is at least 80. When it is, drag the farmer to the research table until your research is at 200. When it is, drag the farmer-turned-scientist back to farm until the food supply is 160. Then drag him/her back to research until it's 300, and so on.

steps.headline: Know that when your mother (the woman with the baby) stops nursing her child, drag her to ANY male older than 18.
steps.description: He will, hopefully, Go inside with her. If she doesn't have a baby in her arms, drag her back. If they come out and she still doesn't, drag her back. Do this over and over again until the woman is fertile.

steps.headline: Figure out the rest of the milestones and win!

text: Drag a random villager (not the woman with the baby!) to the little piece of fruit behind the broken machine and under the tree. If you can't find it, go to the map and click somewhere in the top right corner. The villager will pick up the fruit and plant it. You will either have bananas, coconuts, or mangoes, depending on the fruit you start out with. When your tree is finished growing, a farmer can harvest fruit from it. Drag a villager, preferably with building experience (he or she should have Skill: Trainee Builder) to the firewood pile near the beehive.  Drag another preferably-a-builder villager to the pile of dry grass by the waterfall and above the research building.  When the villagers in Steps 2 and 3 have put their items in the fire pit (in the very middle of the map) drag one of them to the pit again. They will start a fire. Drag a villager that you want to become the farmer to the beehive. They will probably run away. So, drag them to the blackened sticks (torches) next to the beehive. They will start Trying an idea! They will light the torches and hold them in front of the beehive. The bees will fly away and your farmer can start harvesting honey. Drag all the villagers (except the woman with the baby) to the pedestal by the amphitheater. They will try on the cloak. The cloak will fit a villager and the villager will become the Tribal Chief! They help, but they don't work. Drag one builder to the broken hut, close to the fire pit. He or she will start to repair it. Drag your other builder to the big rock covered with leaves in the graveyard, close to the Black Orchid. The builder will start removing the leaves. Drag your Chief to the Granary, the little hut where the food is stored. He will begin Making magical food! Drag any remaining people to the research table in the researching circle. Make sure they research! If you don't have anybody left to research... wait until the food supply (on the side of the screen) is at least 80. When it is, drag the farmer to the research table until your research is at 200. When it is, drag the farmer-turned-scientist back to farm until the food supply is 160. Then drag him/her back to research until it's 300, and so on. Know that when your mother (the woman with the baby) stops nursing her child, drag her to ANY male older than 18. He will, hopefully, Go inside with her. If she doesn't have a baby in her arms, drag her back. If they come out and she still doesn't, drag her back. Do this over and over again until the woman is fertile. Figure out the rest of the milestones and win!
